alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 4:23PM EDT until September 27 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward, Miami-Dade and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the feeder band that brought heavy rains to Broward and Miami-Dade Counties have moved out of the area. However, there could be more feeder bands that could develop over the Atlantic waters and move west northwest into the metro areas that can produce heavy rainfall on top of the already 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen from earlier feeder bands. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect through 6:45 PM EDT this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miami, Hialeah, Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Davie, Miami Beach, Plantation, Sunrise, Deerfield Beach, Tamarac, Margate, Coral Gables, South Miami, Lighthouse Point, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea and Surfside. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
